title: Get a feed for a user
name: GetFeed
description: Retrieves a set of feed items for a specific user
groupDescription: This is a collection of methods that allow you to retrieve the news feed for a user.

title: Get a direct feed for a user
name: GetFeedDirect
description: Retrieves a set of feed items for a specific user that are directly posted to their feed, so not including items that come via follows or mentions.
groupDescription: This is a collection of methods that allow you to retrieve the news feed for a user.

examples.title: HTTP1.1 200 Success
Not-Found:
Server-Error:

title: Add a follower to a user
name: AddFollower
description: Adds a new friend to a user account.

Parameter.description: the guid representation of the user who will be followed
the guid of the user who will be the follower
is the follow private, e.g. only for friends

groupDescription: This is a collection of methods that allow you to create and retrieve follows.

title: Accept a friend request
name: AcceptFriendRequest
description: Accepts a friend request.

Parameter.description: the guid of the user to become friends with

groupDescription: This is a collection of methods that allow you to use the friend request workflow (instead of creating friends automatically).

title: Submit a new friend request
name: AddFriendRequest
description: Adds a new friend request.

Parameter.description: the guid of the user to become friends with

groupDescription: This is a collection of methods that allow you to use the friend request workflow (instead of creating friends automatically).

title: Add a like by a user
name: AddLike
description: Creates a new like of an item

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content: curl --data 'user=405d7e5e-c028-449c-abad-9c11d8569b8f&item=github.com' http://localhost:3000/like

Parameter.description: a canonical url to the item liked

groupDescription: This is a collection of methods that allow you to create and retrieve likes.

title: Check a specific like
name: CheckLike
description: Checks if a user likes a specific item, typically the item is a canonical url.

title: Get details of a relationship
name: GetUserRelationship
description: Retrieves details of a specific user relationship with the current logged in user, intended to be used when viewing someone elses profile.

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content: curl -i http://localhost:3000/user/cbeab41d-2372-4017-ac50-d8d63802d452/relationship

groupDescription: This is a collection of methods that allow you to create and retrieve users.

examples.content:
HTTP1.1 200 Success
{
  "isFriend": true,
  "isFriendSince": "2015-06-01T09:37:51.329Z",
  "isFriendRequestPending": false,
  "isFriendRequestSince": null,
  "youFollow": false,
  "youFollowSince": null,
  "youFollowPrivate": false,
  "youFollowPersonal": false,
  "theyFollow": true,
  "theyFollowSince": "2015-06-01T09:37:51.596Z",
  "theyFollowPrivate": false,
  "theyFollowPersonal": false,
  "inCommon": []
}

Server-Error:
HTTP1.1 200 Success

title: Follower
name: FollowerData
description: Stores follower data from one user to another, this is not necessarily reciprocal, and does not require approval.

Parameter.description: The unique guid for the follower relationship.
The unique guid for the user they are following.
Is the follow visible only to friends.
Is the follow visible only for the user and the person being followed.

groupDescription: This section defines the various table structures used to store the data in Cassandra, as we are using apidoc to generate this documentation, please read the 'parameters' reflects the columns in the tables.

examples.title: Insert Follow
examples.content: INSERT INTO seguir.followers (follow, user, user_follower, since) VALUES(?, ?, ?, ?);

examples.title: Select Follow
examples.content: SELECT follow, user, user_follower, since FROM seguir.followers WHERE follow = ?

examples.title: Select Followers
examples.content: SELECT user, user_follower, since from seguir.followers WHERE user = ?

examples.title: Remove Follow
examples.content: DELETE FROM {KEYSPACE}.followers WHERE follow = ?

title: Friends
name: FriendData
description: Stores a reference to between each user and their friends, this is reciprocal so you get two rows per relationship.

Parameter.description: The unique guid for the friend relationship.
The unique guid for the user they are friends with.

groupDescription: This section defines the various table structures used to store the data in Cassandra, as we are using apidoc to generate this documentation, please read the 'parameters' reflects the columns in the tables.

examples.title: Insert Friend
examples.content: INSERT INTO seguir.friends (friend, user, user_friend, since) VALUES(?, ?, ?, ?)

examples.title: Select Friend
examples.content: SELECT friend, user, user_friend, since FROM seguir.friends WHERE friend = ?

examples.title: Select Friends
examples.content: SELECT user_friend, since from seguir.friends WHERE user = ?

examples.title: Remove Friend
examples.content: DELETE FROM {KEYSPACE}.friends WHERE friend = ?

title: Friend Requests
name: FriendRequestData
description: Stores pending friend requests, stored in a separate table to simplify the relationship management and newsfeed.

Parameter.description: The unique guid for the friend requyest.
The unique guid for the user they are friends with.
The message to send with the request

groupDescription: This section defines the various table structures used to store the data in Cassandra, as we are using apidoc to generate this documentation, please read the 'parameters' reflects the columns in the tables.

examples.title: Insert Friend Request
examples.content: INSERT INTO seguir.friend_request (friend_request, user, user_friend, message, time) VALUES(?, ?, ?, ?)

title: Likes
name: LikesData
description: Stores items that a user 'likes' on their newsfeed, an item can be anything that is representable by a string (e.g. a canonical URL for a page is a typical example, but it can be anything);

Parameter.description: The key of the item liked by the user.

groupDescription: This section defines the various table structures used to store the data in Cassandra, as we are using apidoc to generate this documentation, please read the 'parameters' reflects the columns in the tables.

examples.title: Insert Like
examples.content: INSERT INTO seguir.likes (like, user, item, since) VALUES(?, ?, ?, ?);

examples.title: Select Like
examples.content: SELECT like, item, user, since FROM seguir.likes WHERE like = ?

examples.title: Check Like
examples.content: SELECT like, user, since FROM seguir.likes WHERE user = ? AND item = ?

examples.title: Remove Like
examples.content: DELETE FROM {KEYSPACE}.likes WHERE like = ?

title: Posts
name: PostsData
description: Stores posts that a user (or application) make to a users timeline.

Parameter.description: Optional sub-type for the post, defaults to 'text'.
Is the post only for the user.

groupDescription: This section defines the various table structures used to store the data in Cassandra, as we are using apidoc to generate this documentation, please read the 'parameters' reflects the columns in the tables.

examples.title: Insert Post
examples.content: INSERT INTO seguir.posts (post, user, content, posted) VALUES(?, ?, ?, ?)

examples.title: Select Post
examples.content: SELECT post, content, user, posted FROM seguir.posts WHERE post = ?

title: Users
name: UserData
description: Stores a reference to each user that can have posts, likes, friends and followers.
groupDescription: This section defines the various table structures used to store the data in Cassandra, as we are using apidoc to generate this documentation, please read the 'parameters' reflects the columns in the tables.

examples.title: Insert User
examples.content: INSERT INTO seguir.users (user, username) VALUES(?, ?)

examples.title: Select User
examples.content: SELECT user, username FROM seguir.users WHERE user = ?

examples.title: Select User by Name
examples.content: SELECT user, username FROM seguir.users WHERE username = ?

title: Newsfeed
name: UserLineData
description: Contains the newsfeed for each user, updated by performing any of the Add actions, not interacted with directly.

Parameter.description: The unique timeuuid for the event, this is how the feed is sorted.
The unique guid for the item in the feed - this can be a post, follow, friend or like event.
The string short name for the type of event, valid values are: 'post','follow','friend','like'.
Is this event private and only visible if the user is a friend.
Is this event personal and only visible to the user.

groupDescription: This section defines the various table structures used to store the data in Cassandra, as we are using apidoc to generate this documentation, please read the 'parameters' reflects the columns in the tables.

examples.title: Insert Feed Item
examples.content: INSERT INTO seguir.userline (user, item, type, time) VALUES(?, ?, ?, ?);

examples.title: Select Feed
examples.content: SELECT user, time, dateOf(time) AS date, item, type FROM seguir.userline WHERE user = ? {privateClause}{timeClause} LIMIT {limit}

examples.title: Remove Item from feed)
examples.content: DELETE FROM {KEYSPACE}.userline WHERE user = ? AND item = ?
